item.description: Entity Relationship Diagrams - Cardinality Video Back: [[Entity Relationship Diagrams - Creating Tables]] | Next: [[Entity Relationship Diagrams - Practice Assignment]]
Entity Relationship Diagrams - Basic Structure Entity Relationship Diagrams come in various formats, but they share common elements that help us understand the architecture of a database.
Entity Relationship Diagrams - Creating Tables Practice questions College Courses Diagram Write CREATE statements for the student and instructor tables.

Entity Relationship Diagrams - Data Types and Nullability In addition to showing basic structure of tables and their relationships, Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) can also give us more insight into the columns.

Entity Relationship Diagrams - Introduction Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) are a fundamental part of database design and architecture. They provide a visual representation of the data and how entities within a database relate to each other.
Entity Relationship Diagrams - Practice Assignment In addition to the practice problems from the lesson pages, write queries to do the following: 11.
Entity Relationship Diagrams - Querying Practice questions College Courses Diagram Write a SQL query to retrieve the start date of all classes taught by the instructor named “Tina”.
Entity Relationship Diagrams - Representing Relationships Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) not only show us the entities and their attributes but also how these entities interact with each other.
Before recording - zoom to 150% and collapse bookmarks for extra space. Things I missed and stuff that needs to be fixed on the next pass:
Model 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 public class Book { public int Id { get; set; } public string Title { get; set; } public string Author { get; set; } public int Year { get; set; } } Service
Querying and Analysis for HR Database Project - Assignment Every questions should be answered with exactly one query. You will need exactly one SELECT statement per question.

Querying and Analysis for HR Database Project - HR Database Overview Initialize the HR Database DROP the tables from your previous assignment(s), if necessary See [[Table JOINs - DROP Tables]] for a refresher on dropping tables.
Querying and Analysis for HR Database Project - Introduction This assignment is divided into three sections, each aimed at developing a different aspect of your querying and analytical skills.
Select and Filter Data - Creating a Database Back: [[Select and Filter Data - Introduction]] | Next: [[Select and Filter Data - Running Scripts]]
Select and Filter Data - Introduction In this section, we’ll cover key SQL concepts to help you retrieve, filter and sort the information in your databases.
Select and Filter Data - Logical Operators Logical operators are essential in SQL for combining multiple conditions in the WHERE clause and adding flexibility to your queries.
Select and Filter Data - Note on Semicolons Why use semicolons? So far we’ve only been executing a single query at a time but we could run more.
Select and Filter Data - ORDER BY The ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns.
Select and Filter Data - Practice Assignment In addition to the practice problems from the lesson pages, write queries to do the following:
Select and Filter Data - Running Scripts To get started with hands-on practice, you’ll need data to populate your database.
Select and Filter Data - SELECT Statement Database Basics Refresher Databases exist to help us store and manage large amounts of information in an organized way.
Select and Filter Data - SQL Comments Comments in SQL are used to explain sections of SQL statements, or to prevent execution of SQL statements.
Select and Filter Data - WHERE Clause and Comparison Operators The WHERE clause in SQL is used to filter records from a table, returning only those that meet a specific condition.

SQL For Data Analytics Lesson Index Module One: Introduction to Databases and Relational Tables [[Select and Filter Data - Introduction]] [[Table JOINs - Introduction]] [[Querying and Analysis for HR Database Project - Introduction]] Module Two:
Table JOINs - DROP Tables DROP Tables The DROP command in SQL is used to remove objects from the database.
Table JOINs - Filter and Sort with JOINs Using WHERE and ORDER BY with JOINs We can still utilize the clauses from previous lessons to filter and sort on joined data.

Table JOINs - Introduction In this section, we will: Interact with databases that have multiple related tables. Discuss the different types of relationships tables can have with each other and how these relationships shape the way we retrieve and interpret data.
Table JOINs - JOIN Tables with Many-to-Many Relationships Understanding JOINs in Many-to-Many Relationships Given our bookstore database example from the previous lesson:
Table JOINs - JOIN Tables with One-to-Many Relationships Understanding JOINs in One-to-Many Relationships Given our bookstore database example from the previous lesson:

Table JOINs - Magic Store Database Overview Initialize the Magic Store Database DROP the tables from your previous assignment(s), if necessary Run the following script to populate your database -> MagicStoreScript (github.

Table JOINs - Many-to-Many Relationships Introduction to Many-to-Many Relationships A many-to-many relationship in databases occurs when multiple records in one table are associated with multiple records in another table.
Introduction to One-to-Many Relationships What is a One-to-Many Relationship? In relational databases, a one-to-many relationship is the most fundamental type of relationship.

In addition to the practice problems from the lesson pages, write queries to do the following: Show Products Ordered by a Client: Write a query to list all products ordered by the client with the ID of 2.
Table JOINs - Table Aliasing What is Table Aliasing? Table aliasing involves giving a table in your SQL query a temporary name.
